intro: Diclytra eximia, commonly known as the slender grasshopper beetle, is a species of leaf beetle belonging to the family Chrysomelidae. It is characterized by its elongated, slender body and distinctive coloration, often featuring a metallic green or blue sheen. The plant it is associated with is typically a member of the grass family, where it feeds on grasses and related plants. Its larvae are usually found on the leaves of these host plants, feeding on the foliage. The beetle's life cycle includes several developmental stages, with adults emerging in the spring to continue the cycle.
